    portfolio

    CDIPS Data Science Workshop (January 2017 - present)

    Published: April 01, 2017

    Organizer
    The CDIPS Data Science Workshop is a three-week student-run workshop that pairs small teams of grad students and postdocs with industry mentors to work on data science projects.

    DataRescue SF Bay (January 2017 - February 2017)

    Published: April 01, 2017

    Organizer
    DataRescue SF Bay was an event held at the Berkeley Institute for Data Science to archive environmental data from federal websites.

    Beyond Academia (May 2016 - present)

    Published: April 01, 2017

    Co-Director, January 2017 - present
    Beyond Academia is an organization of approximately 15 graduate student and postdocs at UC Berkeley whose mission is to provide opportunities for our peers to explore careers outside of the tenure track. Our flagship event is a two-day conference featuring dozens of professionals with PhDs who have successfully transitioned to careers outside the tenure track, though we also program other events throughout the year.

    MCB Graduate Student & Alumni Association (June 2015 - present)

    Published: April 01, 2017

    Co-President
    The MCB Graduate Student & Alumni Association is a graduate student-led organization to promote relationships between current graduate students, alumni, and the Department of Molecular & Cell Biology at UC Berkeley.

    MCB Graduate Student Organization (June 2013 – June 2016)

    Published: April 01, 2017

    Secretary, June 2014 - June 2016
    The MCB Graduate Student Organization serves as a liaison between the Graduate Assembly, the department, and our fellow students.

    Graduate Affairs Committee, Dept. of Molecular & Cell Biology (August 2013 - May 2015)

    Published: April 01, 2017

    Student Representative
    The Graduate Affairs Committee is a committee of MCB faculty, administration, and two student representatives that meet monthly during the academic year to discuss the direction of our graduate program.

    Student Health Advisory Committee (September 2012 - April 2016)

    Published: April 01, 2017

    Graduate Student Representative
    The Student Health Advisory Committee is an advisory committee to University Health Services, comprised of representatives of Berkeley student communities.

    Expanding Your Horizons at Berkeley (September 2012 - March 2016)

    Published: April 01, 2017

    Finance & Fundraising Committee, Finance Agent & Signatory, September 2012 - April 2015
    Expanding Your Horizons at Berkeley is a graduate student organization at UC Berkeley that plans an annual day of hands-on workshops for 300-500 middle school girls to encourage their pursuits in STEM fields.

    publications

    Deconstructing Olfactory Stem Cell Trajectories at Single Cell Resolution (under review)

    Published: March 31, 2017

    Paper under review. Date will be revised upon publication.

    Co-first author paper in preparation.

    Published: March 31, 2017

    Manuscript in preparation. Date will be revised upon publication.

    talks

    Neural and Non-Neural Epithelia Utilize Overlapping Gene Repertoires During Regeneration

    Published in Berkeley Stem Cell Center Retreat, 2014

    Authors: Diya Das, Jose Estrada, Melanie Prasol, Yoon Gi Choi, John Ngai, and Russell B. Fletcher.

    Defining Lineage Trajectories and Cell Fate Transitions During Tissue Regeneration Using Single-Cell RNA Sequencing

    Published in Berkeley Stem Cell Center Retreat, 2016

    Authors: Diya Das, Levi Gadye, Michael Sanchez, Kelly N. Street, Davide Risso, Ariane Baudhuin, Michael B. Cole, Allon Wagner, Justin Choi, Elizabeth Purdom, Sandrine Dudoit, Nir Yosef, John Ngai, and Russell B. Fletcher.

    Making a To-Do List That Works for You

    Published in Becoming More Productive: Workflow Strategies for Graduate Students, 2016

    This presentation was part of a workshop hosted by the UC Berkeley Library for students in the life & health sciences.

    Deconstructing Olfactory Stem Cell Trajectories at Single Cell Resolution

    Published in UC Berkeley Computational Biology Retreat, 2016

    Authors: Diya Das1, Russell B. Fletcher1, Levi Gadye6, Kelly N. Street5,8, Ariane Baudhuin1, Allon Wagner2,8, Michael B. Cole3,8, Quetzal Flores1, Yoon Gi Choi7, Nir Yosef2,8, Elizabeth Purdom4,8, Sandrine Dudoit4,5,8, Davide Risso5 and John Ngai1,6,7

    Introduction to R & RStudio

    Published in UC Berkeley - The Hacker Within (Berkeley Institute for Data Science), 2016

    This introduction to R & RStudio was presented in collaboration with Micha Kahlen.

    Deconstructing Olfactory Stem Cell Trajectories at Single Cell Resolution

    Published in UC Berkeley Developmental & Regenerative Biology Retreat, 2017

    I presented several highlights from our single-cell analyses of the trajectories arising from the olfactory stem cell during steady-state differentiation.

    Data Tidying and Transformation in R & Python

    Published in UC Berkeley - The Hacker Within (Berkeley Institute for Data Science), 2017

    Together with David DeTomaso and Andrey Indukaev, I planned a presentation on the basics of data tidying and transformation, performing the same operations in parallel for R & Python, demonstrating the versatility of both languages for data analysis. I presented the R sections while David presented the Python sections. The Jupyter Notebooks we used are located in github.com/diyadas/tutorials.

    Data Visualization in R

    Published in UC Berkeley - The Hacker Within (Berkeley Institute for Data Science), 2017

    Following my presentation with David DeTomaso on data transformation in R & Python, I am planning a presentation on the basics of visualization in R, to be followed by a parallel presentation in Python by David on April 18. The Jupyter Notebooks we will use are located in github.com/diyadas/tutorials.

    teaching

    MCB 160: Introduction to Neurobiology

    Published in UC Berkeley, Department of Molecular & Cell Biology, 2014

    • Taught weekly discussion sections for two sections of introductory neurobiology for upper-level undergraduates.
    • Held office hours, organized exam review sessions, and wrote quiz questions.
    • Coordinated with 3 professors, 1 other Graduate Student Instructor, and several graders to administer and grade exams in a timely manner.

    MCB 104: Genetics, Genomics & Cell Biology

    Published in UC Berkeley, Department of Molecular & Cell Biology, 2015

    • Taught weekly discussion sections for two sections of genetics, genomics, and cell biology for upper-level undergraduates.
    • Held office hours, answered questions on and moderated class discussion board, organized exam review sessions, and wrote review, quiz and exam questions.
    • Coordinated with 3 professors, 4 other Graduate Student Instructors, and several graders to administer and grade exams in a timely manner.
